column1: File:Liz Danforth - Annatar and the Seven Rings.png - Annatar and the seven rings
The Seven Dwarf-rings were the Rings of Power given to seven Dwarves Lords by Sauron in the guise of Annatar. Apparently the Lords were the Kings of the Seven Houses
column2: as Gandalf mentions that the Rings were given to the "Dwarf-kings".

column1: The most famous was the Ring of Thrór: in Dwarven tradition it was said Celebrimbor gave the Ring to Durin III king of Durins Folk before the Downfall of Eregion
column2: but this seems unlikely as Celebrimbor was said to have yielded the Seven - all the Seven - to Sauron after torture.

column1: The Dwarf Lords proved resistant to the malevolent magic of the rings
column2: which could not even turn them invisible
column3: as they are hard to tame
column4: and thoughts of their hearts are hidden. The rings
column5: used only for the gaining of wealth
column6: amplified their wearers natural skills and desire of dominion which as a consequence
column7: made them greedy and exceedingly rich; the Rings gave them the power to multiply whatever they mined. It is said that thanks to them the Seven Hoards were made. But also the Rings kindled greed and wrath in the Dwarves
column8: bringing evils that in the long-term benefitted Sauron.

column1: Four were swallowed or destroyed by Dragons
column2: but Sauron succeeded in finding two. The last one was worn by Thráin
column3: but in  he was imprisoned by Sauron in the dungeons of Dol Guldur
column4: and the ring was taken from him.
